file_content.text: Advice for free; tech and training at cost.
I am Rally Master Kelborn. Your sponsor's been rather insistent that his "investment" is prepared to win the Great Hunt.
You'll need to decide what sort of training will best suit your fighting style. Take a minute to look over your options.
A good blaster's all I need.
I'd rather get to work.
Confidence is a poor substitute for preparation.
Now I choose my equipment, right?
Do I get new gear?
Like you, weapons and armor have limits. Overload your systems, and the stress on your equipment may cause it to give out under pressure.
Mastering combat takes practice and focus. Spread yourself too thin and you excel at nothing.
You and I don't have business.
Back in one piece, more or less.
Nem'ro wants to ensure you're ready for the worst--and the Great Hunt is sure to test that.
I'll expect you soon.
The galaxy's full of pretenders.
I'm not most.
Don't be so quick to dismiss pretenders. Even the meek can fight well when pushed.
Most would have turned back or died before getting a pat on the back from Zakkeg or Gen.
I thought we all got along well enough.
They weren't so bad.
The only thing Zakkeg and Gen have ever agreed on is your chances of winning the Great Hunt.
You may think you're ready for that spot in the Great Hunt--maybe you are--but are you ready to compete against a Mandalorian?
I've arranged for you to meet two of my peers, specialists in their fields.
They should give you a taste of how real hunters customize their kit to suit their individual battle styles.
I'd rather be ready for anything.
Why specialize?
I don't need your friends to tell me how to handle my equipment.
I know what I want.
I thought Zakkeg sent you to see Gen.
Good.
Zakkeg's expecting you.
[Reflecting on the lessons you learned from Braum and Gen, you see two paths before you.]
[The punishing, offensive techniques of a dual blaster-wielding Mercenary, or the nearly unsurmountable defensive tactics of a heavily armored Powertech.]
[A tough decision, and one you'll have to stick with throughout your career.]
I wish to become a Mercenary.
I wish to become a Powertech,
I'm not ready to choose.
